messages.message: Guys! There's an indicident going on at the moment. Getting reports that users can't log in. Checking logs now.
Seeing a spike in 500s from the auth service. Looks like a DB connection issue?
Monitoring dashboards—requests are piling up, latency is through the roof. Something is definitely off.
Customer Support is blowing up—users locked out across all regions. Do we have an ETA?
Rolling back the latest auth-service deployment. Might be related.
Rollback didn't fix it. Issue persists.
Confirming—DB connections are maxed out, seeing timeouts in the pool.
Could this be related to last week's infra changes? We updated how auth-service handles connection retries.
Just got a message from the VP—this is impacting a key client. We need updates every 30 mins.
Narrowed it down—seems like a new rate-limit check is failing and blocking auth requests. Investigating fix.
We can manually clear blocked requests, but that's not a real fix. Need a patch.
Temp fix deployed—extended connection timeout as a stopgap. Users still seeing issues, though.
Pushed a hotfix—disabled the faulty rate-limit check. Seeing normal auth traffic now. Can someone confirm?
Metrics are stabilizing. Logins are back up. Looks good so far.
Customer Support confirms logins are working for most users. Still waiting on final confirmation from some clients.
Ok guys, at the end of the day, even though we had an incident, it's been resolved. Let's schedule a postmortem on Wednesday. Thanks, everyone!
